      • showDialog

        public void showDialog​(java.lang.String title,
                       GeoPointMetaData originalPoint,
                       boolean editable,
                       GeoPointMetaData mapCenter,
                       CoordinateFormat coordinateFormat,
                       boolean showAffiliation,
                       CoordinateEntryCapability.ResultCallback callback)
        Show a dialog with the appropriate view and must be run on the ui thread
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the dialog box
        originalPoint - the point that is currently to be used in each of the panes
        editable - if the screens are editable or for display purposes only.
        mapCenter - the center of the map when the dialog was shown
        coordinateFormat - the coordinate format used for selecting the pane to show, null will show the last user selected pane.
        showAffiliation - if it is desired to show the affiliation selector at the bottom of the screen.
        callback - the callback that is used when the dialog is dismissed

      • showDialog

        public void showDialog​(java.lang.String title,
                       GeoPointMetaData originalPoint,
                       boolean editable,
                       GeoPointMetaData mapCenter,
                       java.lang.String paneid,
                       boolean showAffiliation,
                       CoordinateEntryCapability.ResultCallback2 callback)
        Show a dialog with the appropriate view and must be run on the ui thread
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the dialog box
        originalPoint - the point that is currently to be used in each of the panes
        editable - if the screens are editable or for display purposes only.
        mapCenter - the center of the map when the dialog was shown
        paneid - the pane identifier that should be presented, null uses the last user selected pane identifer
        showAffiliation - if it is desired to show the affiliation selector at the bottom of the screen.
        callback - the callback that is used when the dialog is dismissed

      • showDialog

        public void showDialog​(java.lang.String title,
                       GeoPointMetaData originalPoint,
                       boolean editable,
                       boolean displayElevationControls,
                       GeoPointMetaData mapCenter,
                       java.lang.String paneid,
                       boolean showAffiliation,
                       CoordinateEntryCapability.ResultCallback2 callback)
        Show a dialog with the appropriate view and must be run on the ui thread
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the dialog box
        originalPoint - the point that is currently to be used in each of the panes
        editable - if the screens are editable or for display purposes only.
        displayElevationControls - if the elevation controls should be shown
        mapCenter - the center of the map when the dialog was shown
        paneid - the pane identifier that should be presented, null uses the last user selected pane identifer
        showAffiliation - if it is desired to show the affiliation selector at the bottom of the screen.
        callback - the callback that is used when the dialog is dismissed

      • findId

        public java.lang.String findId​(java.lang.String wnn)
        Given a well known name, return the first panel id that is encountered that matches the well known name.
        Parameters:
        wnn - the well known name for a coordinate type which is case insensitive.
        Returns:
        the unique identifier for the well known name or null if no well known name is found.

      • findWellKnownName

        public java.lang.String findWellKnownName​(java.lang.String paneid)
        Returns a well known name of a coordinate pane given the pane id.
        Parameters:
        paneid - the pane id to get the well known name
        Returns:
        returns a well known name or null if the panel id is not valid.

      • format

        public java.lang.String format​(java.lang.String id,
                               GeoPointMetaData gp)
        Given a coordinate entry panel id, convert the geopoint into a human readable format for display to the user.
        Parameters:
        id - the id
        gp - the geopoint
        Returns:
        the human readable name.

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Releases all resources associated with the Object. The Object should not be used following an invocation of this method and any usage will result in undefined and possible application ending behavior.
